business.headline: Sensex, Nifty close higher on GST buzz, easing global tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 370.64 points, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 103.70 points to settle at 24,980.65. Broader markets also ended in the green, with mid- and small-cap stocks outperforming.

PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana: Who can get Rs 15,000 and other benefitsFirst-time employees under Part A can receive a one-time incentive equal to about one month's basic pay, up to Rs 15,000, paid in two instalments.

Two retirees, Rs 2 crore each, yet one runs out of money early. CA explains whyTwo retirees may have the same Rs 2 crore in savings, but their financial journeys can differ drastically. A CA explains how market timing and sequencing risk can decide who runs out of money first.

Are next-gen GST reforms a done deal?The next-gen GST overhaul could redefine India's tax landscape, but consensus among states and revenue concerns will decide its fate. For now, GST 2.0 is a promise, not a done deal. Read to know why.

ITR-U explained: Check eligibility, deadline, and penalties for updated returnsThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has made it simpler for taxpayers to correct errors in their income tax returns through the updated ITR-U. Here's a guide on who can file, the deadline, and possible penalties.

Why you should wait until October for big purchases, explains expertIf you've been planning to buy a car, air conditioner, or other expensive items, it might be wise to hold off for a few weeks. Expert says waiting until October could save you money thanks to upcoming GST reforms.

Why lower GST is better for your wallet than income tax reliefUnlike income tax, which applies only to those earning above a certain threshold, GST is an indirect tax levied on almost every transaction, covering nearly everything you buy.
How the SCL fire in Mohali sabotaged India's chip dreamsThe blaze caused losses estimated at Rs 75 crore in 1989, but the true cost the nation would pay would be known decades later.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares rose 7% in early tradeOla Electric's rising share price appears to be a result of renewed investor optimism, driven by the company's ambitious EV targets and gigafactory plans, but sustaining momentum will depend on market share recovery.

Sensex, Nifty gain as GST reforms buzz keeps investor sentiment bullishAt 9:21 am, the S&P BSE Sensex climbed 150.78 points to 81,424.53, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 38.15 points to 24,915.10. Most broader market indices also traded in the green during early deals, indicating improved investor sentiment.

Next-generation GST reforms will reduce tax burden, boost growth: CEAChief Economic Advisor Dr. V Anantha Nageshwaran said the GST overhaul, coupled with earlier tax cuts, will lower consumer costs, ease inflation, and boost disposable incomes, calling it a transformative step in India's eight-year tax reform journey

Received a fake income tax call? Key warning signs and tips to protect yourselfScammers are increasingly posing as income tax officials to trick people into sharing personal and financial information. If you receive a suspicious call during the filing season, it's important to stay calm and know the warning signs before taking any action.

entertainment.headline: Rukmini Vasanth says bagging a role in Kantara Chapter 1 was a dream come trueActor Rukmini Vasanth joined the cast of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'.  She described the opportunity as a dream come true as she shared the excitement and challenges of keeping the project a secret.

Thama teaser X reactions: Fans compare Ayushmann, Rashmika's vampire film to MCUFans have compared Ayushmann Khurrana, Rashmika Mandanna's 'Thama' teaser to Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). Viewers also praised Nawazuddin Siddiqui's appearance in the teaser.

Faissal Khan to legally separate from family: Will file petition in a month's timeAamir Khan's brother Faissal claimed that he will legally cut ties with his family. Faissal will file a petition in a month's time on the same.

Shruti on Kamal Haasan's reaction to Thug Life failure: Numbers don't affect himShruti Haasan, in a recent interview, recently opened up about how Kamal Haasan reacted to the failure of 'Thug Life', which marked his reunion with Mani Ratnam after 38 years. She explained how his father views cinema.

Gulshan Devaiah makes Kannada debut with Rishab's Kantara Chapter 1, poster outBollywood actor Gulshan Devaiah will be making his Kannada debut with Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1'. The makers made the announcement by unveiling his character's poster on social media.

It Ends With Us actor Isabela Ferrer alleges Justin Baldoni of bullyingActor Isabela Ferrer is facing legal challenges amid Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's feud. Ferrer played young Lily in Baldoni's directorial 'It Ends With Us'.

Bigg Boss 19: Media house tour of Salman Khan's show hit by Mumbai rainsSalman Khan hosted 'Bigg Boss 19' is set to premiere on August 24. Ahead of the grand evening, the media tour of the house has been stalled due to Mumbai rains.

If Sholay was remade, who'd be Jai-Veeru: Sherlock Holmes investigatesA cult classic collides with a timeless sleuth. As Sholay marks half a century, Holmes and Watson debate who could possibly fill the boots of Jai and Veeru.

Who is Rachita Ram, the antagonist who stood out in Coolie's ensemble cast?Rachita Ram is a Kannada actor who made her feature film debut in 2013. She has featured in several hit films that involved some of the biggest names in the Kannada film industry, and recently made her Tamil debut in Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' as one of the antagonists, Kalyani.

Why Zakir Khan's stand-up at packed Madison Square Garden feels like personal successAt Madison Square Garden, Zakir Khan proved that dreams spoken in Hindi, with the accent of Indore and the honesty of a 'sakht launda', can be realised across the world. That standing ovation was a gratitude to Khan for being raw, real and unapologetically desi.

KBC 17: Factory worker wins Rs 25 lakh, shares dream of taking wife on Manali tripIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a factory worker won Rs 25 lakh. After winning the amount, he shared his dreams of taking his wife to Manali.

We're safe: Rubina Dilaik updates fans after being stranded in Himachal rainsActor Rubina Dilaik expressed relief and gratitude after finding shelter in Himachal Pradesh amid heavy rain and landslides. The actor reassured fans on Instagram that she and her children are safe.

Prince Narula condemns firing at Elvish Yadav's home, calls it unacceptableActor Prince Narula condemned the firing incident at Elvish Yadav's Gurugram home on Monday. He expressed concern for Yadav's family on Instagram and called it unacceptable.

The Defects review: Compact yet ambitious original K-drama that will surprise youRelease Date:Mon Jul 21, 2025The Defects is a gripping K-drama that challenges societal values through a unique story of genetically engineered children fighting for survival. Available on Channel K in India, it blends thriller elements with deep moral questions in a near-future setting.

Kichcha Sudeep buys land for Vishnuvardhan's new memorial in BengaluruKichcha Sudeep bought new land to build the Vishnuvardhan Darshan Centre as debates continue over the demolished memorial. President of the Vishnusena Committee Veerakaputra Srinivas made the announcement recently.

Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan reunite after 46 years as ageing gangsters: ReportsRajinikanth and Kamal Haasan are likely to join hands for director Lokesh Kanagaraj's next film. Reports are rife that this film will be a gangster drama.

Taylor Swift's new Showgirl vinyl variants sell out in less than an hourGlobal pop sensation Taylor Swift's new vinyl editions of The Life of a Showgirl sold out in under an hour, continuing her run of instant fan favourites.

Exclusive: Mithun Chakraborty to join Superstar Rajinikanth in Jailer 2Mithun Chakraborthy has been roped in to play a pivotal role in Superstar Rajinikanth's 'Jailer 2'. The film is being directed by Nelson Dilipkumar.
Thama teaser: Ayushmann, Rashmika's next promises a dark and bloody love storyThe teaser of Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna's next 'Thama' is out. The film is set to release on Diwali 2025.

general news.headline: With Sudershan Reddy, INDIA bloc's googly in vice-presidential contest with NDASources said the decision to field a candidate of "great credibility outside the political sphere" was intended to make it harder for regional parties to oppose.

Shubman Gill vice-captain, Jasprit Bumrah in as India announce Asia Cup squadShubman Gill has been named vice-captain to Suryakumar Yadav as India announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming Asia Cup in the UAE. The eight-team tournament will be held from September 9 to 28, with India placed in Group A alongside Oman, Pakistan, and the UAE.

Rahul Gandhi to be Opposition's PM pick? Tejashwi Yadav's remark sparks buzzTejashwi Yadav's remarks indicate that Rahul Gandhi would be the face of the INDIA bloc in the 2029 polls. The leadership conundrum has been a prickly issue for the INDIA bloc.

Expert deletes post on Maharashtra voters amid 'vote chori' row, faces BJP firePsephologist and Lokniti-CSDS co-director Sanjay Kumar's faulty data on voter surges in two Maharashtra seats—Nashik West and Hingna—has triggered a storm, amid Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "vote-chori" allegations. Kumar deleted his post in which he shared the data, and apologised. The BJP attacked the expert and the Congress.

The ghost of Super 301: Why US trade wrath always finds IndiaWhat started as President Trump's trade campaign against China seems now to be focused on India. This has a strange echo from 35 years ago, when the US started out to target Japan, its economic rival, with the Super 301 but ended up with India in its crosshairs. This is how the governments of Rajiv Gandhi and VP Singh reacted then.

BCCI stops reporter from asking Pakistan-related questionIndian cricket team chief selector Ajit Agarkar was stopped from responding to questions about Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement. The BCCI representative at the meeting shut the question down.

IndiGo passenger says co-pilot barged into toilet when she was inside, airline reactsA late-night flight turned into a nightmare for a Mumbai-based entrepreneur when an IndiGo co-pilot barged into the lavatory while she was inside.

Next 48 hours crucial: CM Devendra Fadnavis as non-stop rain paralyses Mumbai Live UpdatesAccording to Flightradar, 253 outbound and 163 inbound flights at Mumbai Airport were delayed, while Central Railway trains ran 20-30 minutes late.

Who is Gopal Patha of Bengal Files? A Hindu hero or hoodlumGopal Mukherjee's grandson has filed an FIR over his portrayal in Vivek Agnihotri's The Bengal Files. Agnihotri says the film portrays Mukherjee as a hero. History has been divided over Gopal Patha, who organised Hindu resistance against Muslim mobs who went on the rampage during the Direct Action Day of 1946 in what is known as the Great Calcutta Killing.

Setbacks of last few years not in our interest: Wang Yi at meeting with Ajit DovalSpeaking in New Delhi during the 24th round of Special Representative Level Talks on the boundary question, he noted that the October 2024 meeting between President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Kazan had provided direction for the development of bilateral relations and given fresh impetus to efforts at resolving boundary issues.
Rajasthan's Manika Vishwakarma crowned Miss Universe India 2025With her victory, Manika Vishwakarma now steps onto the global stage as India's representative at Miss Universe 2025 in Thailand.

Why Delhi's stray dogs belong to its lanesMass relocation of strays risks overcrowding, disease and eroded emotional bonds. The way forward is humane solutions grounded in sterilisation and community care

Who is Sudershan Reddy, known for role in Justice Sen impeachment, Ambanis disputeFormer Supreme Court judge Sudershan Reddy has had a legal career spanning five decades. Here is everything you need to know about him.

Dragon's classroom: Why China's takeover of UK schools should worry Indian parentsChinese investors are buying up Britain's venerable but often financially fragile private schools at an unprecedented rate, and it's time we asked the uncomfortable questions: Is this just business, or is it a strategic move by the Chinese Communist Party?

Why Zakir Khan's stand-up at packed Madison Square Garden feels like personal successAt Madison Square Garden, Zakir Khan proved that dreams spoken in Hindi, with the accent of Indore and the honesty of a 'sakht launda', can be realised across the world. That standing ovation was a gratitude to Khan for being raw, real and unapologetically desi.

Mahindra employee threatens BJD MP with rape on Facebook, firm orders probeThe BJD MP shared screenshots of the threats issued by the Mahindra Group employee in a post on X, tagging Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Amit Shah.

Who is Rachita Ram, the antagonist who stood out in Coolie's ensemble cast?Rachita Ram is a Kannada actor who made her feature film debut in 2013. She has featured in several hit films that involved some of the biggest names in the Kannada film industry, and recently made her Tamil debut in Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' as one of the antagonists, Kalyani.

Online Gaming Bill regulating betting apps, penalising gambling, gets Cabinet nodThe Online Gaming Bill seeks to bring online gaming platforms under a legal framework and introduce penalties for gambling through digital apps.

CBSE's open-book exams could end the era of rote learning in schoolsCBSE's new open-book exam plan for Class 9 marks a decisive shift away from rote memorisation, pushing students toward critical thinking and application-based learning. Piloted successfully, the reform is now set to reshape classrooms, teaching styles, and exam preparation across India.

How Narendra Modi's expressway push is redrawing India's urban map"Development our fate... one milestone at a time," said PM Modi while inaugurating the Dwarka Expressway and the Urban Extension Road-II in Delhi

If Sholay was remade, who'd be Jai-Veeru: Sherlock Holmes investigatesA cult classic collides with a timeless sleuth. As Sholay marks half a century, Holmes and Watson debate who could possibly fill the boots of Jai and Veeru.

Renuka Singh returns in India squad for Women's World Cup, Australia ODIsIndia have included Renuka Singh Thakur as India named their squads for the Women's ODI World Cup and the three-match ODI series against Australia. Shafali Verma, however, didn't find a place in the team for both the series.

Gautam Adani at IIT Kharagpur: Renewable energy, invisible wars and AtmanirbhartaAt IIT Kharagpur's 75th Foundation Day, Gautam Adani spoke on renewable energy, AI, data security, self-reliance, the age of "invisible" wars" and more, urging students to prioritise legacy over salary while announcing new fellowships and industry partnerships.

Heavy rain, thunderstorm in parts of Delhi-NCR; Orange alert issuedThe weather department has issued an orange alert for the national capital, forecasting heavy rain and strong winds for the next two hours.

Rukmini Vasanth says bagging a role in Kantara Chapter 1 was a dream come trueActor Rukmini Vasanth joined the cast of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'.  She described the opportunity as a dream come true as she shared the excitement and challenges of keeping the project a secret.

She explained how his father views cinema.

sports.headline: Will vice-captain Shubman Gill start for India in Asia Cup? Agarkar explainsShubman Gill's appointment as India's T20I vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 sparks debate over his place in the starting XI, as Ajit Agarkar and the selectors weigh form, hierarchy, and a settled top order.

Renuka Singh returns in India squad for Women's World Cup, Australia ODIsIndia have included Renuka Singh Thakur as India named their squads for the Women's ODI World Cup and the three-match ODI series against Australia. Shafali Verma, however, didn't find a place in the team for both the series.

India want Bumrah for big tournaments, no fixed workload plans: AgarkarAjit Agarkar clarified that Jasprit Bumrah's workload management is not a fixed ordeal. He suggested that India sees him as a key player who they want to take part, especially when it comes to the big games.

Not their fault, not ours: Agarkar explains Yashasvi and Shreyas Asia Cup snubAsia Cup 2025: Ajit Agarkar clarified the reasons behind Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer missing out on India's squad. India's campaign in the tournament starts on September 10 in Dubai.

BCCI stops reporter from asking Pakistan-related questionIndian cricket team chief selector Ajit Agarkar was stopped from responding to questions about Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement. The BCCI representative at the meeting shut the question down.

Shubman Gill vice-captain, Jasprit Bumrah in as India announce Asia Cup squadShubman Gill has been named vice-captain to Suryakumar Yadav as India announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming Asia Cup in the UAE. The eight-team tournament will be held from September 9 to 28, with India placed in Group A alongside Oman, Pakistan, and the UAE.

Manu Bhaker continues consistent run, wins 10m bronze in Asian ChampionshipsManu Bhaker secured a bronze medal in the women's 10m air rifle event at the Asian Shooting Championship. Her consistent performance highlights India's growing strength in continental shooting competitions.

Dewald Brevis' promising ODI debut ends in two balls against Travis HeadAUS vs SA: Dewald Brevis lit up his ODI debut with a first-ball six against Australia in Cairns, but his fireworks ended just two deliveries later as Alex Carey caught him at long-on. The cameo echoed Johann Louw's unique 2008 feat of starting his ODI batting career with a six.

After quitting Mumbai, Prithvi Shaw smashes century in maiden knock for MaharashtraBuchi Babu Invitational 2025: Prithvi Shaw made a strong impact with a century in his first competitive match for Maharashtra. The 25-year-old hit a composed hundred on a challenging pitch against Chattisgarh in Chennai.

Rohit Sharma should continue as India's ODI captain till 2027 World Cup: RayuduAmbati Rayudu supports Rohit Sharma continuing as India's ODI captain ahead of the 2027 World Cup. He emphasises Rohit's leadership and fitness as key to India's success and stresses Virat Kohli's vital role at number three.

Pakistan annual contracts: Babar, Rizwan demoted, no players in Category AThe Pakistan Cricket Board has reshuffled its central contracts for 2025-26. They have taken the big decision of demoting star players Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan.

Manu Bhaker continues consistent run, wins 10m bronze in Asian ChampionshipsManu Bhaker secured a bronze medal in the women's 10m air rifle event at the Asian Shooting Championship. Her consistent performance highlights India's growing strength in continental shooting competitions.

Dewald Brevis' promising ODI debut ends in two balls against Travis HeadAUS vs SA: Dewald Brevis lit up his ODI debut with a first-ball six against Australia in Cairns, but his fireworks ended just two deliveries later as Alex Carey caught him at long-on. The cameo echoed Johann Louw's unique 2008 feat of starting his ODI batting career with a six.

The 25-year-old hit a composed hundred on a challenging pitch against Chattisgarh in Chennai.

He emphasises Rohit's leadership and fitness as key to India's success and stresses Virat Kohli's vital role at number three.

Pakistan annual contracts: Babar, Rizwan demoted, no players in Category AThe Pakistan Cricket Board has reshuffled its central contracts for 2025-26. They have taken the big decision of demoting star players Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
